definitions: bright ring of light around something luminous or holy
science fiction video game series featuring futuristic warfare
cognitive bias where positive impression influences overall perception
examples: The moon had a beautiful halo around it last night
Saints are often depicted with golden halos above their heads
He spent hours playing Halo with his friends online
The new Halo game broke sales records worldwide
The halo effect made her overlook his obvious flaws
Celebrity endorsements rely heavily on the halo effect principle

definitions: any of five chemically related elements including fluorine, chlorine, bromine, iodine, and astatine
examples: Halogen bulbs produce bright white light for automotive headlights
The periodic table shows halogens in group seventeen
Sodium chloride contains the halogen element chlorine
Fluoride toothpaste contains the halogen fluorine for cavity prevention

definitions: sudden cessation of movement or activity
small railway station without regular staff or facilities
examples: The train came to an abrupt halt at the signal
Production ground to a halt during the strike
The train stopped briefly at the rural halt
Passengers waited at the request halt for the morning train

definitions: headgear for leading or tying up horses without a bit
women's garment with straps around the neck leaving back and shoulders bare
examples: She put a leather halter on the horse before leading it
The stable had halters hanging on every stall door
She wore a summer halter top to the beach party
The halter dress showed off her tanned shoulders beautifully

definitions: preserved leg of pork prepared by curing, smoking, or salting
licensed amateur radio enthusiast who operates broadcasting equipment
actor who overacts or exaggerates their performance dramatically
examples: She made sandwiches with honey glazed ham and mustard
The holiday ham was the centerpiece of their dinner
The old ham radio operator contacted stations around the world
During emergencies, ham operators provide vital communication services
That actor is such a ham when performing Shakespeare
He hammed it up for the cameras during the interview

definitions: seasoned ground beef formed into a flat round patty
sandwich consisting of cooked meat patty in a bun with toppings
examples: She shaped the hamburger into patties for grilling
The butcher ground fresh hamburger from chuck roast
He ordered a double hamburger with cheese and bacon
The restaurant serves gourmet hamburgers with exotic toppings

definitions: tiny rural settlement smaller than a village with few houses
famous tragedy by William Shakespeare about the Danish prince
examples: The peaceful hamlet had only twenty residents year-round
They discovered a charming hamlet nestled in the valley
Students studied Hamlet in their literature class this semester
The actor's portrayal of Hamlet earned critical acclaim

definitions: hand tool with weighted head for striking nails or breaking things
auctioneer's gavel used to signal sales and maintain order
small bone in middle ear that transmits sound vibrations
examples: He used a claw hammer to remove the old nails
The blacksmith shaped metal with a heavy hammer
The auctioneer's hammer fell to close the bidding
Going under the hammer means being sold at auction
The hammer bone connects to the anvil in your ear
Damage to the hammer can cause hearing problems

definitions: distinctive shark with flattened head extending sideways like a hammer
the broad flattened head part of a hammer tool
examples: The hammerhead shark swam past the diving cage
Scientists study hammerhead sharks' unique sensory capabilities
He replaced the damaged hammerhead on his favorite tool
The hammerhead was loose and needed tightening

definitions: continuous loud pounding or striking with force
overwhelming defeat or harsh criticism in competition or evaluation
examples: The hammering from the construction site lasted all day
We heard hammering coming from the workshop downstairs
The team took a hammering in yesterday's match
The company's stock took a hammering after poor earnings

definitions: canvas or rope bed suspended between two supports for relaxation
examples: She dozed in the hammock under the palm trees
They hung a colorful hammock between two oak trees
The sailor slept in a hammock below deck
Camping hammocks are lightweight alternatives to tents

definitions: large basket with lid for holding dirty clothes before washing
decorative basket filled with food or gifts as a present
examples: She tossed her dirty clothes into the laundry hamper
The bathroom hamper was overflowing with towels
They received a luxury hamper filled with gourmet treats
The Christmas hamper contained wine, cheese, and chocolates

definitions: small furry rodent kept as pet with pouches for storing food
examples: The hamster ran on its wheel throughout the night
She bought a golden hamster from the pet store
Her hamster stuffed its cheeks with sunflower seeds
The classroom hamster became the children's favorite pet

definitions: any of three tendons at the back of the human knee
vulnerability that prevents effective action or progress in planning
examples: The athlete tore his hamstring during the sprint
Tight hamstrings can cause lower back pain
Budget constraints hamstring our expansion plans completely
Security concerns became the project's main hamstring

definitions: part of body at end of arm with fingers
pointer on clock or measuring device
cards held by player in game
manual worker or crew member
assistance or aid given to someone
examples: She raised her hand to ask a question
The surgeon had steady hands during the operation
The clock's minute hand pointed to twelve
The pressure gauge hand indicated danger levels
He was dealt a winning hand in poker
She kept her hand hidden from other players
The ship needed more hands for the voyage
Ranch hands worked from dawn until dusk
Could you give me a hand with these boxes
They offered a helping hand to their neighbor

definitions: small to medium bag carried by women for personal items
examples: She searched through her handbag for her keys
The leather handbag matched her shoes perfectly
Designer handbags can cost thousands of dollars
She keeps her essentials in a small handbag

definitions: team sport where players hit ball with hands against wall or into goals
illegal touching of ball with hands or arms in soccer
examples: They played handball at the recreation center every week
Olympic handball requires speed, strength, and teamwork
The referee called handball against the defender
That handball penalty cost them the match

definitions: concise reference book providing specific information or instructions about a subject
examples: The employee handbook outlined company policies and procedures
She consulted the handbook for troubleshooting steps
Students received a handbook during freshman orientation
The survival handbook contained essential wilderness skills

definitions: quantity that fills or can be held in the hand
small number or amount of something
person or thing that is difficult to control or manage
examples: She grabbed a handful of berries from the bowl
He scooped up a handful of sand

Managing three puppies at once was a handful

definitions: small firearm designed to be held and operated with one hand
examples: Police officers carry handguns as part of their equipment

The shop sells various handguns for self-defense

definitions: disadvantage given to superior competitor to equalize chances
system for rating golfers' playing ability
physical or mental condition limiting person's movements, senses, or activities
examples: The faster horse carried a weight handicap
Time handicaps made the chess match more balanced
His golf handicap improved from twenty to fifteen
Players with lower handicaps have better skills
Parking spaces are reserved for people with handicaps

definitions: person having a physical or mental disability that limits activities
examples: The handicapped parking spaces are closest to the entrance

definitions: decorative or useful object made skillfully by hand using traditional methods
examples: The market featured local handicrafts like pottery and weaving

Tourists bought handicrafts as souvenirs from their trip
The museum displayed handicrafts from various cultures

definitions: something made or done by hand showing skill
result or consequence of someone's actions or efforts
examples: The quilt was a beautiful example of her handiwork
His handiwork was evident in the carved furniture
The graffiti was clearly the handiwork of local teenagers
This mess is your handiwork, now clean it up

definitions: small square of fabric for wiping nose or face
examples: He pulled out a handkerchief to wipe his forehead

definitions: part of object designed to be held when used or moved
unique username or identifier used online or in communications
examples: The pot's handle was too hot to touch
She grasped the door handle and pulled hard

Radio operators identify themselves by their call handle

definitions: curved steering bar with handles at each end on bicycle or motorcycle
examples: He gripped the handlebars tightly while riding downhill

definitions: person who manages or deals with particular things or situations
person who trains or controls animals professionally
examples: The baggage handlers loaded luggage onto the plane

definitions: way something is managed, controlled, or dealt with
physical touching, moving, or controlling of objects
examples: The handling of customer complaints improved significantly

definitions: female domestic servant or personal attendant
something that serves a subordinate or supporting role
examples: The handmaid served tea to the lady's guests

definitions: act of passing something from one person to another, especially in sports or work
examples: The quarterback executed a perfect handoff to the running back

definitions: formal transfer of authority, responsibility, or possession from one party to another
examples: The handover of power occurred peacefully after the election

definitions: rail fixed along stairs or ramps for support when walking
examples: She held the handrail while climbing the steep stairs

definitions: part of telephone held to ear and mouth during calls
examples: She picked up the handset when the phone rang

definitions: act of grasping and shaking someone's hand as greeting or agreement
exchange of signals between devices establishing communication parameters
examples: Their firm handshake sealed the business deal
A handshake is customary when meeting someone new

SSL handshake ensures secure communication between servers

definitions: person's particular style of writing by hand with pen or pencil
examples: Her handwriting was neat and easy to read

Children practice handwriting in elementary school

definitions: person skilled at various minor repairs and maintenance tasks
examples: The handyman fixed the leaky faucet and squeaky door

Local handymen advertised their services in the newspaper

definitions: way something is suspended or draped
death by suspension from the neck
examples: The hang of the curtains wasn't quite right

Capital punishment by hang was common centuries ago

definitions: large building for housing and maintaining aircraft
examples: The private jet was stored in the airport hangar

definitions: shaped frame for holding clothes in closet or wardrobe

examples: She organized her closet with matching wooden hangers

definitions: execution by suspension from the neck until dead
decorative piece of fabric or artwork hung on wall
examples: The museum exhibit described historical hangings

definitions: person who carries out executions by hanging

definitions: place where someone spends time relaxing or socializing regularly

definitions: unpleasant physical effects following heavy alcohol consumption
something that remains from or is influenced by past events

definitions: coil or loop of rope, hair, yarn, or other material
examples: She bought a hank of wool for her knitting project

definitions: informal or dialectal term for handkerchief
examples: Grandpa always carried a hankey in his pocket

definitions: monkey deity in Hinduism symbolizing courage, strength and devotion

examples: Devotees prayed at the Hanuman temple every Tuesday

definitions: event or occurrence, especially one of interest or importance
fashionable or exciting place or event
examples: Strange happenings occurred in the old mansion
The festival was the biggest happening of the summer
The new club is really happening on weekends

definitions: aggressive pressure or intimidation through unwanted behavior
illegal behavior that creates hostile or offensive environment
examples: She filed a complaint about workplace harassment

definitions: person or thing that announces or signals the approach of something
examples: Robins are harbingers of spring in northern climates

These symptoms may be harbingers of serious illness
